PERSONAL DETAILS  
 
Location:   France - Malling  
 
 
QUALIFICATIONS  
 
PhD in Chemical Engineering Ecole Nationale Supérieure des Industries Chimiques  (ENSIC) – Nancy

Languages  
French – mother tongue  
English – profess ional working proficien cy 
 
 
CAREER SUMMARY  
 
April 2022  to date  Evonik Operations GmbH  
Position:  Business Segment Manager (hydroprocessing)  
 
2016 to Mar. 2022 Porocel (Evonik group)  
Position : Business Segment Manager (hydroproces sing)  
• Development of global marketing strategies for established and new technologies Catalyst 
Recovery Europe S.A.  
• Establishment of global technical service strategies and protocols Rodange (Luxembourg)  
• Support business devel opment initiatives for products as well as services  
• Contribution to improvements, reliability, performance and profitability of technologies  from a 
manufacturing and R&D point of view  
• Products/technologies benchmarking to define best technologies/produ cts for customer needs  
• R&D projects management in collaboration with internal and external partners, IP review  
• Management of chemical PhD and chemical engineer: daily supervision, yearly assessment, 
training need  
 
2013 to 2016 Porocel (Evonik group)  
Position: Technical Service Manager (h ydroprocessing & adsorbents)  
• Performance simulations for catalysts as well as adsorbents Catalyst Recovery Europe S.A.  
 • On-site technical support for reactor loading, unit start -up, troubleshooting, process 
optimizations Rodange ( Luxembourg)  
• Supervision/coordination/optimization of plant trials for new products/services launch  
• R&D projects management in collaboration with internal and external partners, IP review  
• Main outcomes: international patents related to Excel ® rejuven ation technology, main inventor  
• Sales department training on new technologies, workshops, customer visits and international 
conferences  
 
2008 to 2013 Porocel (Evonik group)  
Position: Laboratory Manager  
• Analytical lab development for metal analyses by X -Ray Fluoresc ence (XRF) Catalyst Recovery 
Europe S.A.  
• Management of 4 laboratory technicians: yearly assessment, training need Rodange 
(Luxembourg)  
• Implementation of ISO 9001 & ISO 14001 norms for the Lab department  
• Supervision of daily production quality contro l 
• Analytical devices maintenance and calibration (AAS, XRF, C&S analyzers, TGA, ASE etc)  
• New analytical methods development according to the sales/production needs  
• Management of R&D projects in collaboration with internal and external partners, IP re view 
• Development of new technologies: catalyst rejuvenation, metal leaching, passivation  
• Supervision/coordination/optimization of plant trials for new products launch  
 
2005 to 2008 ) Ecole Nationale Supérieure des  Industries Chimiques (ENSIC)  
Position: Researcher (PhD in chemical engineering  
• Removal process development of air pollution by photocatalysis: application to VOCs  
• Collaboration with a public lab (PC2A) in Lille to highlight the hydroxyl radical diffusion in gas 
phase by LIF (Laser Induced  Fluorescence)  
• Strong involvement in an industrial project (Rhovyl) to propose a purification solution by  
photocatalysis of gaseous effluents polluted by acetone and carbon disulfide (preliminary study  
and annular reactor design)  
• Scientific production : 7 international publications including 6 as the first author, 2 international  
• conferences, 3 posters  
• Education: practical work supervision in Physical – Chemistry for about 30 BA students 
Université Henri Poincaré (UHP)  (290 hr on 3 years)  
 
Jan. – June 2 005 Université Louis Pasteur (ULP)  
Position : Engineer of Environmental Toxicology (internship)  
• Exposure of health -workers to Quatern

career_advancement: Focus on building core technical skills
Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
